definition: flat/(coll.) to beat (sb) up/old variant of 匾[bian3]
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: Most flatworms are hermaphrodite and, in tapeworms, self-fertilization usually takes place.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的扁蟲雌雄同體，絛蟲常常進行自體受精。
